commit.message: travis: Run tests on 16.04 for Python 3.7, 3.8-dev

Restore support for Python 2.7.0-2.7.8

`hashlib.algorithms_guaranteed` was introduced only in Python 2.7.9, see https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/hashlib.html#hashlib.algorithms_guaranteed

Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (which will be supported until April 2019) still provides python 2.7.5 and therefore needs this fix.

Tested on python 2.7.3, 2.7.5, 2.7.12 and 3.5.3.

verification.payload:
tree cd92289f59a1d4114ff186eddce0c40132054fca
parent c39b650a80837a1d32314599143d0b5b04159248
author Nicola Soranzo <nicola.soranzo@gmail.com> 1544181586 +0000
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1544181586 +0000

Restore support for Python 2.7.0-2.7.8

`hashlib.algorithms_guaranteed` was introduced only in Python 2.7.9, see https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/hashlib.html#hashlib.algorithms_guaranteed

Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (which will be supported until April 2019) still provides python 2.7.5 and therefore needs this fix.

Tested on python 2.7.3, 2.7.5, 2.7.12 and 3.5.3.

commit.message: remove useless default values from namespace

always set bag_info on namespace

attribute wouldn't be set without any metadata args. also removes the need to check for AttributeError

assign bag_info from arguments to namespace instead of parser

Python docs recommend to add properties to namespace, this allows for parsers to be reused.

commit.message: Blacken support files

setup.py: support running in minimal locales

This is moot on most systems but a minimal docker container
with LC_ALL=C would previously fail:

LC_ALL=C LANG=C python3.6 setup.py --long-description

Closes https://github.com/LibraryOfCongress/concordia/issues/69
Update gettext message template
Add dependencies for dev tools
Reformat source using Black

Drop support for Python 2.6

This is starting to cause other packages to fail and Python
2.6 has been deprecated for half a decade at this point.
